results.title: Child care and development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
The film gives overall consideration to the habits of daily physical care that ensure a happy, healthy child. Correct attitudes and procedures toward establishing good habits of eating, sleeping, and bathing are covered. Stresses the elements of good diet. The question of proper clothing - warm and light for the infant, sturdy and functional for the toddler - is explored. Raises the important consideration of suitable and becoming clothing as exerting considerable psychological influence on personality development. The importance of outdoor exercise is stressed. The film shows the importance of the attitudes of both parents and children towards good routines of daily living.

results.title: Clash (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Child Care and Development”.
Coming up to the age of two, children are really beginning to assert their independence and this can often lead to a clash of will with their parents. The film looks at a wide range of different incidents involving children of this age and viewers are asked to decide what they would do if they were the parents.

results.title: Kathy and Ian: three-year-olds
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Child”.
By the age of three children become aware of themselves as unique. This happens through their continuing interaction with parents, siblings and friends. This film explores these relationships and the resulting development within the child.

results.title: 4 years-6 years = Four years to six years
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Dorothy Courtois, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Child”.
By the age of four the child is curious about the world around him. To find out, he is asking thousands of questions. He is also learning not to be afraid. This film shows children in learning situations: on a nature hike; handling animals and other creatures; dealing with their peers. One particularly interesting example is that of Ingrid and Helen, twins who look alike but act differently.

results.title: Debbie and Robert: 12-24 months (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Child”.
Debbie and Robert’s behaviour is typical of the second year of life. Illustrates the process of learning that goes on through every waking hour, and the kind of guidance a parent can give.

group_works.title: Jamie, Ethan and Marlon: the first two months

results.title: Jamie, Ethan and Marlon: the first two months
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Child”.
He has just made his debut into the world. How does he shape up? In this first film, a pediatrician explains what he looks for when he gives a newborn infant his first physical checkup—testing reflexes, muscle tone, eye movement, etc. Three babies are observed, first in hospital, then at home in the care of their parents.

results.title: If we don't go, we'll never know, will we?
results.creator_credit: Russell Toose, Constance Bernstein and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chequerboard”.
The Gordons, with their four children, are migrating from England to australia. This film interviews the Gordons in England and hears of their hopes and dreams. It then spends the first six months in Australia with the family to find out the reality. Reporters: Richard Oxenburgh, Robert Higson.
